metadata.title: CVE-2017-16228 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Dulwich before 0.18.5, when an SSH subprocess is used, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via an ssh URL with an initial dash character in the hostname, a related issue to CVE-2017-9800, CVE-2017-12836, CVE-2017-12976, CVE-2017-1000116, and CVE-2017-1000117.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-16228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-dulwich - 0.18.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dulwich package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.5-1').
